reasoning: HNPCC/Lynch Syndrome is a genetic syndrome characterized by mismatch repair gene mutations. Reporting prevalence of genetic carriers (~1 in 400 people) at approximately 250 per 100k population. Affected carriers have 70-80% lifetime risk of colorectal cancer and significantly elevated risk of other malignancies (endometrial, stomach, ovarian cancers). Incidence not applicable as this represents genetic predisposition rather than incident disease.
source: Lynch HT et al. (2003). Hereditary nonpolyposis colorectal cancer (Lynch Syndrome): An updated review. Cancer. 100(4):681-689
